channel.title: BC Growing Laws?
channel.description: A friend of mine recently started growing his own weed, no intent to sell. Worries me. He started with only 3, but now he has upwards of 20. He's a good kid, going places, so I was curious as to if anyone knew anything about BC's growing laws like if there's a legal amount, etc.

item.title: BC Growing Laws?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Cultivation, possesion, and trafficking of marijuana is illegal EVERYWHERE in Canada. Cultivation is an indictable offense. The difference with BC is that they are more slack on it. Traffickers and cultivators are the main target, and if he was caught growing he could face up to 7 years in prison. 20 plants is a lot, there’s no way 20 plants is for his own personal use so you can be sure they would charge him with trafficking as well.

Marijuana laws are the same everywhere in Canada, it’s just enforced differently. To be honest he’d probably just get a fine

Unhandled:

I don’t think you’re allowed to grow even if you have a medical prescription.

False
